body_text:
There are three states that a study can be in:

Enrolling: Actively enrolling users
Paused: Do not enroll new users, but continue to run on existing users
Rollback: End the study for all users that are still active, do not enroll new users

One proposal for handling these three states is to add an option to the arguments for study recipes that controls whether to enroll new users, and adding pre- and post-execution handlers that uninstall any studies that are active but didn't match the user, similar to what we do for preference experiments.
To pause enrollment, you check the box, and to rollback a study, you disable the entire recipe.
@rehandalal @MattGrimes Thoughts on this UI?
